page.title: 10Birds Corn Mill Beetham
page.content: Heron Corn Mill got its name from the herons that roosted in the oakwoods that once existed nearby.The oakwoods were felled in the seventeenth century to provide timber for the Navy.The displaced herons fought with the rooks at Dallam.The trouble lasted many years,but both sides settled down to live at the woods at Dallam. Up in the beams of the ground floor ceiling there is a wrens nest.It was one of several built by a cock wren about four years ago.His mate had a good look at it and chose the one across the river.He still uses the one in the mill as his bachelor pad. The area around the mill is very rich in bird life particularly water birds.
